responses.rationale: Vivid descriptions of symptoms ('Screaming very loud', 'whole-body tremors') trigger Q2 (Vivid Verb).
Explicit low-risk language ('risk... remains low') triggers Q5 (Explicit Calming/Low Risk).
Factual statement of a risk factor and outcome ('higher risk') without explicit framing cues.
Vivid verb ('dying out') describing the outcome for the species triggers Q2 (Vivid Verb).
